exe.bbllw8.demiurge.either

Class Right<A,B>

  • java.lang.Object
    • exe.bbllw8.demiurge.either.Either<A,B>
      • exe.bbllw8.demiurge.either.Right<A,B>

  • public final class Right<A,B>
extends Either<A,B>
    The right side of the disjoint union, as opposed to the Left side.

    This class is not serializable.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    See Also:
    Either, Left

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Right(B value) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean contains(B elem)
      Returns true if this is a Right and its value is equal to elem (as determined by Object.equals(Object)), returns false otherwise.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o) 
      boolean exists(java.util.function.Function<B,java.lang.Boolean> predicate)
      Returns false if Left or returns the result of the application of the given predicate to the Right value.
      Either<A,B> filterOrElse(java.util.function.Function<B,java.lang.Boolean> predicate, A fallback)
      Returns Right with the existing value of Right if this is a Right and the given predicate p holds for the right value, or an instance of Left with fallback as argument if this is a Right and the given predicate does not hold for the right value, or an instance of Left with the existing value of Left if this is a Left.
      <B1> Either<A,B1> flatMap(java.util.function.Function<B,Either<A,B1>> function)
      Binds the given function across Right.
      static <A,B> Either<A,B> flatten(Right<A,Either<A,B>> either) 
      <C> C fold(java.util.function.Function<A,C> functionLeft, java.util.function.Function<B,C> functionRight)
      Applies functionLeft if this is a Left or functionRight if this is a Right.
      boolean forAll(java.util.function.Function<B,java.lang.Boolean> predicate)
      Returns true if Left or returns the result of the application of the given predicate to the Right value.
      void forEach(java.util.function.Consumer<A> consumerLeft, java.util.function.Consumer<B> consumerRight)
      Executes a given side-effecting function depending on whether this is a Left or Right.
      void forEach(java.util.function.Consumer<B> consumer)
      Executes the given side-effecting function if this is a Right.
      B getOrElse(B fallback)
      Returns the value from this Right or the given fallback if this is a Left.
      int hashCode() 
      boolean isLeft()
      Returns true if this is a Left, false otherwise.
      boolean isRight()
      Returns true if this is a Right, false otherwise.
      static <B,C> Either<C,B> joinLeft(Right<Either<C,B>,B> either) 
      static <A,C> Either<A,C> joinRight(Right<A,Either<A,C>> either) 
      LeftProjection<A,B> left()
      Allows for-comprehensions over the left side of Either instances, reversing the usual right-bias of the Either class.
      <C> Either<A,C> map(java.util.function.Function<B,C> function)
      The given function is applied if this is a Right.
      Either<A,B> orElse(Either<A,B> alternative)
      Returns this Right or the given argument if this is a Left.
      java.util.stream.Stream<B> stream()
      Returns a stream containing the right value if this is a Right, otherwise, Stream.empty().
      Either<B,A> swap()
      If this is a Left, then returns the left value in Right or vice versa.
      java.util.Optional<B> toOptional()
      Returns a Optional with the right value if this is a Right, otherwise, Optional.empty().
      java.lang.String toString() 
      <A1> Either<A1,B> upcast()
      Up-casts this Right with another left side type.
